messages.message:
Let's talk about what they want to hear and what already assume.
[1] They want to learn about the power of Instabase: Refiner, Redactor, Flow, etc.
[2] They most likely assume that the system is scalable and reliable. Should we skip infra topic then?

good point, do we remove the idea that scalability/throughput is in question? Does it sound good to go from we will process documents in near real time to we will process documents in real time? So far I am coming away with messaging isnt about volume, its about speed? Do we want to direct it back to volume or drop it?
The problem is with both velocity and volume. We do well on variability.
We don't care what we do well on, we care about what we are now going to give you.
We are now going to give you the ability to do Z
Yea, I am aware. I am providing you with context. Both speed and volume are a problem.
We are addressing volume problem for large data sets this year.
Okay so volume is a feature
We should be able to work on velocity problem for small data sets as well. But, we haven't discussed this a lot internally.
lets stick with volume, without going into the big data territory (Avoiding that at all costs).
I'm thinking we drop the entire messaging of it
unless we can make it seem like we are delivering something amazing.
